title: Collaborative Learning Design for Enhancing Digital Literacy Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic digital tools and practical work experience in scientific fields
context.additional_context: Project-based collaborative learning course for practicing professionals conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners design and implement science data analysis projects utilizing the six core competencies of the Digital Literacy Framework (DLF): visual-literacy, information, reproduction, branching, socio-emotional, and real-time thinking.
Learners distribute knowledge sharing and task ownership among team members using technology-based self-regulation strategies during collaborative learning.
Learners resolve cognitive/emotional challenges and develop social interactions while creating and sharing digital content using smartphone-based tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
